result.namespace_description: Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: enterprise
fields.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

fields.name: enabled_organizations
fields.description: Required. The policy that controls the organizations in the enterprise that are allowed to run GitHub Actions. Can be one of: all, none, or selected.

fields.name: allowed_actions
fields.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions and reusable workflows that are allowed to run. Can be one of: all, local_only, or selected.

result.namespace_description: Set allowed actions and reusable workflows for an enterprise

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: enterprise
fields.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

fields.name: github_owned_allowed
fields.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed. For example, this includes the actions in the actions organization.

fields.name: verified_allowed
fields.description: Whether actions from GitHub Marketplace verified creators are allowed. Set to true to allow all actions by GitHub Marketplace verified creators.

fields.name: patterns_allowed
fields.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s) and reusable workflow(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, monalisa/octocat@*, monalisa/octocat@v2, monalisa/*."

fields.name: access_level
fields.description:

repository. none means access is only possible from workflows in this repository. Can be one of none, organization, enterprise.

fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: secret_name
fields.description: secret_name parameter

result.namespace_description: Create or update an organization secret

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: secret_name
fields.description: secret_name parameter

fields.name: encrypted_value
fields.description: Value for your secret, encrypted with LibSodium using the public key retrieved from the Get an organization public key endpoint.

fields.name: key_id
fields.description: ID of the key you used to encrypt the secret.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description:
Required. Configures the access that repositories have to the organization secret. Can be one of:
- all - All repositories in an organization can access the secret.
- private - Private repositories in an organization can access the secret.
- selected - Only specific repositories can access the secret.

fields.name: selected_repository_ids
fields.description: An array of repository ids that can access the organization secret. You can only provide a list of repository ids when the visibility is set to selected. You can manage the list of selected repositories using the List selected repositories for an organization secret, Set selected repositories for an organization secret, and Remove selected repository from an organization secret endpoints.

result.namespace_description: List jobs for a workflow run

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: run_id
fields.description: The id of the workflow run.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Filters jobs by their completed_at timestamp. Can be one of:
* latest: Returns jobs from the most recent execution of the workflow run.
* all: Returns all jobs for a workflow run, including from old executions of the workflow run.Default: latest

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Results per page (max 100)Default: 30

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

result.namespace_description: Re-run a job from a workflow run

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: job_id
fields.description: job_id parameter

result.namespace_description: List workflow runs for a repository

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: actor
fields.description: Returns someone's workflow runs. Use the login for the user who created the push associated with the check suite or workflow run.

fields.name: branch
fields.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch of the push.

fields.name: event
fields.description: Returns workflow run triggered by the event you specify. For example, push, pull_request or issue. For more information, see "Events that trigger workflows."

fields.name: status
fields.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run status or conclusion that you specify. For example, a conclusion can be success or a status can be in_progress. Only GitHub can set a status of waiting or requested. For a list of the possible status and conclusion options, see "Create a check run."

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: Results per page (max 100)Default: 30

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: created
fields.description: Returns workflow runs created within the given date-time range. For more information on the syntax, see "Understanding the search syntax."

fields.name: exclude_pull_requests
fields.description: If true pull requests are omitted from the response (empty array).

fields.name: check_suite_id
fields.description: Returns workflow runs with the check_suite_id that you specify.

fields.description: If true pull requests are omitted from the response (empty array).

fields.name: comment
fields.description: Required. A comment to accompany the deployment review

Only GitHub can set a status of waiting or requested. For a list of the possible status and conclusion options, see "Create a check run."

result.namespace_description: Create a workflow dispatch event

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Setting toapplication/vnd.github.v3+json is recommended.

fields.name: workflow_id
fields.description: The ID of the workflow. You can also pass the workflow file name as a string.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: Required. The git reference for the workflow. The reference can be a branch or tag name.

fields.name: inputs
fields.description: Input keys and values configured in the workflow file. The maximum number of properties is 10. Any default properties configured in the workflow file will be used when inputs are omitted.
